node.title: Private security could soon guard secretive naval communications base instead of AFP
node.alt: A big sign in the right handside foreground and a seires of tall antenna behind it at dusk in remote wa
node.description: One of the country's most secretive and important military facilities, which helps support Australian and US naval operations, could soon be guarded by private security personnel, rather than federal police.
node.content:
["One of the country's most secretive and important military facilities, which helps support Australian and US naval operations, could soon be guarded by private security personnel\u00a0rather than federal police.", "Correspondence obtained by the ABC reveals the Defence Department is planning to end a long-standing contract with the AFP to protect the Harold E Holt Naval Communications Station, with a contractor to take over the role early next year.\u00a0", "Established in the 1960s, the West Australian base was named after former Prime Minister Harold Holt and provides Very Low Frequency (VLF) communication transmission services in support of Australian, US and allied submarines.", "Last week, around 25 Australian Federal Police officers based at Exmouth were told they would soon be replaced by private security guards, in a move that has drawn concern from Pentagon officials.\u00a0", "\"The AFP has been advised of Defence's intention to cease the AFP's security arrangements at Harold E Holt (HEH) Naval Communications Station, Exmouth, Western Australia,\" police officers were told.", "\"Defence intend to transition to a private security provider in early 2022,\" the AFP's Assistant Commissioner for the Western-Central Command, Chris Craner, said\u00a0in his message to staff.", "", "
An aerial shot of the Harold Holt Naval Communications station in remote WA.(Google Maps)
", "\"This will result in the closure of the AFP Station in Exmouth. The AFP are working closely with Defence in regards to the exact timeline for major change\".", "The Australian Federal Police Association (AFPA) has expressed shock at the decision, warning it could have \"national security\" consequences.", "AFPA President Alex Caruana has written to Defence Minister Peter Dutton urging him to intervene to ensure sworn AFP Protective Service Officers are kept at the communications station.\u00a0", "\"The decision of the Department of Defence, in the view of the AFPA, will undermine the protection of vital national security assets in a time when national security should be at the forefront of decisions being made, noting regional instability and the rising threats posed to Australia,\" Mr Caruana said\u00a0in his letter, which was also sent to members of Federal Parliament's Joint Committee on Security and Intelligence.\u00a0", "\"We are of this view as a private security provider will not be afforded the powers akin to those afforded to Protective Service Officers under the AFP Act.", "\"[It] will not have the robust regimes in place to ensure high level of protection and those who provide the protection, and such a provider will not have the ability to access the capabilities, resources, and expertise currently available from the wider AFP.", "Defence has not responded to a request for comment, but the ABC has been told the department is now debating whether the decision to move to private security arrangements could be overturned.\u00a0", "American officials have also privately expressed concerns about the proposal, although the US embassy in Canberra has declined to comment publicly.", "", "
The Harold E Holt Naval Communication Station is right on the WA coastline.(Defence:\u00a0CPL Nick Wiseman)
", "Gordon Flake, the head of the Perth USAsia Centre at the University of Western Australia, believed\u00a0the Harold E Holt facility would become increasingly important.", "\"We're at a phase right now if you look at the Defence Strategic Update, if you look at the changing security environment in the world, where Australia should be strengthening its position in its northern and western approaches and that includes the area around Exmouth where we have existing facilities,\" he said."]
